meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a line on a map marking the limits of an area within which a particular linguistic feature occurs.
meanings.sent1: The isoglossic boundary separates the regions with different accents.
meanings.sent2: Linguists use isoglossic maps to study language variations.
meanings.sent3: The isoglossic line on the map seemed to dance as it defined the language areas.
meanings.sent4: The isoglossic division between the dialects was as clear as a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The isoglossic concept made the linguistic boundaries vivid and easy to understand.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to isoglosses or the study of them.
meanings.sent1: The isoglossic analysis helped in understanding language distribution.
meanings.sent2: Researchers conducted isoglossic studies to explore language patterns.
meanings.sent3: The isoglossic research project turned into a fascinating journey of discovery.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like an isoglossic map, connecting language features effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The isoglossic approach made the study of language boundaries engaging and insightful.
